content:
The conversion of solid CaSO into solid CaO and SO gas is an
4 2
example of what class of chemical reaction:
W) decomposition
X) hydrolysis
Y) combustion
Z) single replacement
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the oxidation number of chromium in the chromate ion, or
CrO 2–?
4
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the most common term for the method Louis Pasteur used to
create the first rabies vaccine?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following BEST describes how Pasteur attenuated the
rabies virus to create an effective vaccine:
W) by heat-treating the purified virus
X) by treating the live virus with a weak solution of formaldehyde
Y) by passing the rabies infection through a successive series of rabbits
Z) by purifying the protein from the viral capsids
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: Y) BY PASSING THE RABIES INFECTION THROUGH A SUCCESSIVE SERIESOF RABBITSHigh School Round 5 Page 1

content: The nucleus of what element is the same as an alpha particle?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Name all of the following 4 choices that would typically be considered
to supply electromotive force: transformers; generators; batteries; conductors
subject: PHYSICS
answer: TRANSFORMERS; GENERATORS; BATTERIES(ACCEPT: ALL BUT CONDUCTORS)

content:
Simplify the following without the use of negative exponents:
10y6z2
12x3
subject: MATH

content:
It takes 20 minutes for Janis to prepare lunch. When Kristen helps, it only
takes 12 minutes. How many minutes would it take Kristen to prepare the same lunch if she worked
alone?
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following is commonly accepted as the
engine that most directly drives plate tectonic motion:
W) mantle convection
X) volcanic off-gassing
Y) a molten iron core
Z) gravitational pull of the Moon and Sun
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Although scientists are unable to obtain samples by
drilling, they believe the predominant mineral in the mantle is:
W) iron pyrite
X) potassium feldspar
Y) quartz
Z) olivine
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
What is the MOST accurate term for predicting values
of data that are located between known data points on a line graph:
W) extrapolation
X) extension
Y) interpolation
Z) cheating
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Convert 0.001 grams per cubic millimeter into kilograms
per cubic meter:
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
The luminosity of a star is most directly related to the star’s:
W) relative magnitude
X) magnitude
Y) distance from Earth
Z) intrinsic brightness
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
At which of the following locations would Betelgeuse most
likely be found by a stargazer at mid-northern latitudes during January at about midnight:
W) at the beginning of the handle of the big dipper
X) at the zenith near the star Vega
Y) about 10º north of Orion’s belt in the southern sky
Z) in the northern sky just above the star Capella
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) ABOUT 10º NORTH OF ORION’S BELT IN THE SOUTHERN SKY

content:
Ca(OH) , NaOH, and Ba(OH) , are all:
2 2
W) weak bases
X) completely ionized in water
Y) alkali halides
Z) standard buffers
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following compounds is most SOLUBLE in water
at 10ºC:
W) KNO
3
X) CaSO
4
Y) BaSO
4
Z) AgBr
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following molecules do methanogens (read as: meth-
AN-oh-gens) most often use as their final electron acceptor in their generation of energy:
W) hydrogen
X) carbon dioxide
Y) methane
Z) oxygen
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What is the general biological term for organisms that synthesize
organic molecules from inorganic molecules using light as an energy source?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following BEST explains why gravitational
acceleration on Earth varies from one place to another:
W) the Sun’s gravitational pull varies irregularly
X) the Earth is not a uniform sphere
Y) the Moon and the Sun exert a complex combination of gravitational pulls on the Earth
Z) the changing angular momentum of the Earth varies during its yearly orbit
subject: PHYSICS
answer: X) THE EARTH IS NOT A UNIFORM SPHERE

content: If a wave has a frequency of 500 hertz, what is its period, in seconds?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
In a circle with diameter AB, if the radius is 6 centimeters, find the
length in centimeters, giving your answer in terms of π, of the arc AB:
subject: MATH

content:
Find the area, in square centimeters, of a rhombus with a diagonal of 6
centimeters and a side of 5 centimeters:
subject: MATH
answer: 24(Solution: A = ½ d d = ½ (6)(8) = 24 cm2, (3:4:5 triangle))1 2

content:
Which of the following is NOT true:
W) Mount Everest is a volcanic mountain
X) shield volcanoes have surface slopes of only a few degrees
Y) the depression on the top of a typical composite volcano is known as a crater
Z) Mount Kilimanjaro is a stratovolcano
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: W) MOUNT EVEREST IS A VOLCANIC MOUNTAIN

content:
Which of the following are likely to form in the crater of a
stratovolcano following a catastrophic eruption, such as what happened several times in Mount Saint
Helens:
W) cinder cones
X) lava domes
Y) flood basalts
Z) spatter cones
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
answer: X) LAVA DOMESHigh School Round 5 Page 6

content:
Biomagnification is MOST likely to result in the
concentration of toxic chemicals in:
W) chemoautotrophs
X) eutrophic lakes
Y) primary consumers
Z) primary producers
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
HDPE is a tough plastic often used for the manufacture
of toys. What monomer is the primary repeating unit in this polymer?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
The formation of what is referred to as “metallic hydrogen” on
some of the our solar system’s planets is driven by what basic force?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following would typically appear to be the
farthest away from the ecliptic:
W) the planet Mars
X) the constellation Leo
Y) the Sun
Z) the constellation Cassiopeia
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Z) THE CONSTELLATION CASSIOPEIA(Solution: planets, the Sun and zodiacal constellations are all near the ecliptic plane)High School Round 5 Page 7

content:
The electronegativity of oxygen is 3.4 and the electronegativity
of calcium is 1.0. Which of the following best describes the formation of the calcium oxide:
W) 2 electrons are transferred from calcium to oxygen
X) 2 electrons are transferred from oxygen to calcium
Y) 2 electrons are shared between calcium and oxygen
Z) 1 electron is shared and another is transferred from calcium to oxygen
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: W) 2 ELECTRONS ARE TRANSFERRED FROM CALCIUM TO OXYGEN

content:
What is the chemical formula for the conjugate base of HNO ?
2
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
By words or numbers, name all of the following 3 functions that
meiosis accomplishes:
1) reducing the copies of alleles in the ovum and sperm
2) reducing the numbers of chromosomes in the ovum and sperm
3) increasing genetic diversity through chromosomal exchange events
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which one of the basic 3 plant cell types has irregularly thickened
cell walls, retains its cytoplasm, and functions in structural support?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is the part of an electric motor that
functions as an electromagnet:
W) ballast
X) relay
Y) armature
Z) brushes
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Using g rounded to the first decimal place, how much does an
80-kilogram person weigh on Earth, giving your answer in proper SI units?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
A jar of 100 marbles contains only 2 colors of marbles, red and blue. If
there are 13 red marbles for every 12 blue marbles, how many blue marbles are in the jar?
subject: MATH

content:
Solve the following inequality for x: |3 – 2x| ≤ 7 (read as: the absolute
value of, 3 minus 2x, close absolute value, is less than or equal to 7)
subject: MATH

content:
Which of the following is igneous and pyroclastic in
nature, and is of variable composition:
W) pumice
X) obsidian
Y) gabbro
Z) tuff
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following are clastic in origin:
W) chalk
X) coal
Y) gypsum
Z) sandstone
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is an all but obsolete battery
technology stopped by government regulations in this country because of toxicity issues:
W) nickel-cadmium cells
X) mercury-oxide cells
Y) zinc-air cells
Z) aluminum-air cells
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following best explains why carbon
monoxide is very harmful to animals:
W) it binds very strongly to hemoglobin
X) it is an irritant to the alveolar lining
Y) it is a highly potent neurotoxin
Z) it causes a severe allergic reaction
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: W) IT BINDS VERY STRONGLY TO HEMOGLOBINHigh School Round 5 Page 10

content: What terrestrial planet has the most elliptical orbit?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Although you might expect this planet to be visible to the
unaided eye because of its maximum apparent magnitude value of about +5.8, what planet is
unlikely to be seen by most stargazers since it requires nearly ideal viewing conditions?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
Which of the following ions does NOT have a noble gas
electron configuration in ionic compounds:
W) Ca2+
X) F–
Y) Al3+
Z) Na–
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Charles law is particularly useful in explaining which of the
following:
W) dry air is more dense than humid air
X) CO escapes from a bottle of soda when opened
2
Y) the change in enthalpy when nitrogen and oxygen react to form nitrogen dioxide
Z) a hot-air balloon rises when the air in the balloon is heated
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: Z) A HOT-AIR BALLOON RISES WHEN THE AIR IN THE BALLOON ISHEATED(Solution: W = Avogadro’s law; X = Henry’s law; Y = Hess’s law)High School Round 5 Page 11

content:
What are the common names for the 2 functional groups that
combine to form a peptide bond?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: AMINO; CARBOXYL (ACCEPT: AMINE AND CARBOXYLIC ACID)

content:
What 2 ions are most directly involved with the conduction of a
nerve cell message down an axon?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: SODIUM AND POTASSIUM (ACCEPT: Na+ AND K+)

content:
A boat’s velocity has a northward velocity component of 15
kilometers per hour and an eastward component of 10 kilometers per hour. Which of the following
BEST represents the direction of the boat’s motion:
W) 35 kilometers per hour northeast
X) 35 kilometers per hour southwest
Y) 18 kilometers per hour northeast
Z) 12 kilometers per hour northeast
subject: PHYSICS

content:
What are the frequencies of the first and second overtones,
respectively, for a string vibrating at a fundamental frequency of 440 hertz?
subject: PHYSICS
